questions.title: Crisis Intervention Services for Students

questions.name: q1
questions.title: Does the university offer a crisis intervention team that responds to sexual assaults on campus? (Crisis intervention would include an on-call, 24-hour emergency staff available to assist students who have experienced sexual assault.)

questions.name: q1a
questions.title: Where is information about resources located?

questions.name: q2
questions.title: Does the campus identify and provide contact information for trained on- and off-campus advocates and counselors who can provide an immediate, confidential crisis-response in a crisis situation?

questions.name: q2a
questions.title: Where is information about resources located?

questions.name: q3
questions.title: Is there an anonymous hotline that students can call to get information about available resources regarding sexual violence either on campus or in the community?

questions.name: q3a
questions.title: Where is information about resources located?

questions.name: q4
questions.title: Does the university offer students a confidential space for sexual violence disclosure either in the form of:
choices: Staff member protected by confidentiality statuses
Representative from community-based center with such privileges who works part-time on campus

questions.name: q4b
questions.title: Where is information about resources located?

questions.name: q5
questions.title: If the answer to the previous question is no, does the campus have a collaborative relationship with community partners that can respond to sexual violence?

questions.name: q5a
questions.title: Where is information about resources located?

questions.name: q6
questions.title: Does the university offer free and confidential counseling for students who experience sexual assault?

questions.name: q6a
questions.title: Where is information about resources located?

questions.name: q7
questions.title: Does the university offer free and confidential longterm counseling and assistance for students who experience sexual assault?

questions.name: q7a
questions.title: Where is information about resources located?

questions.name: q8
questions.title: Does the university offer support groups for students who have experienced sexual assault?

questions.name: q8a
questions.title: Where is information about resources located?

questions.name: q9
questions.title: Does the campus health center have a mission statement that pledges to understand trauma and engage in trauma-sensitive practice?

questions.name: q9a
questions.title: Where is information about resources located?

questions.name: q10
questions.title: Does the campus health center provide on-going training in trauma-sensitive practice to all health center staff?

questions.name: q10a
questions.title: Where is information about resources located?

questions.name: q11
questions.title: Does the campus health center integrate trauma-sensitive concepts, language, and training requirements to staff, including new hires?

questions.name: q11a
questions.title: Where is information about resources located?

questions.name: q12
questions.title: Does the campus health center incorporate questions that screen for sexual assault in their intake questionnaire?

questions.name: q12a
questions.title: Where is information about resources located?

questions.name: q13
questions.title: Does the campus health center have handouts available for students, including:
choices: School-specific information for filing complaints, resources, and contact lists
General information explaining patient rights, self-care, intimate partner violence, sexual assault
Know Your Rights by the U.S. Department of Education

questions.name: q13a
questions.title: Where is information about resources located?

questions.name: q14
questions.title: Does the campus health center articulate an organizational commitment of respect that specifically includes persons from other cultures and those associated with commonly marginalized groups, such as African Americans, Latinos, and LGBTQI individuals?

questions.name: q14a
questions.title: Where is information about resources located?

questions.name: q15
questions.title: Does the campus provide victims options to seek treatment for injuries and other health services either on campus or at a local health care provider?

questions.name: q15a
questions.title: Where is information about resources located?

questions.name: q16
questions.title: Does the campus provide victims options to seek preventative treatment for sexually transmitted diseases either on campus or at a local health care provider?

questions.name: q16a
questions.title: Where is information about resources located?

questions.name: q17
questions.title: Does the campus provide victims options to seek emergency contraception either on campus or at a local health care provider?

questions.name: q17a
questions.title: Where is information about resources located?

questions.name: q18
questions.title: Does the campus provide SANE examinations for victims?

questions.name: q18a
questions.title: Where is information about resources located?

questions.name: q19
questions.title: If you answered no to the previous question, does the campus have a collaborative partnership with a local medical provider that can conduct a SANE examination?

questions.name: q19a
questions.title: Where is information about resources located?

questions.name: q20
questions.title: If SANE examination is conducted off campus, is transportation for victims provided?

questions.name: q20a
questions.title: Where is information about resources located?

questions.name: q21
questions.title: Does the campus provide information to students about the importance of preserving evidence as might be necessary to prove criminal sexual assault?

questions.name: q21a
questions.title: Where is information about resources located?

questions.name: q22
questions.title: Does the campus health center have MOUs with off-campus agencies such as:
choices: Local hospitals with a SART response team

questions.name: q22a
questions.title: Where is information about resources located?

questions.name: q23
questions.title: Does the campus offer advocacy services 24 hours/day to students for immediate response?

questions.name: q23a
questions.title: Where is information about resources located?

questions.name: q24
questions.title: Does the campus provide victims with an advocate who can provide information about the legal system and accompany students to court appointments?

questions.name: q24a
questions.title: Where is information about resources located?

questions.name: q25
questions.title: Does the campus provide victims with an advocate to accompany students to forensic exam and hospital appointments?

questions.name: q25a
questions.title: Where is information about resources located?

questions.name: q26
questions.title: Does the campus provide sexual assault victims options for, and available assistance in changing academic, living, transportation, and working situations, if requested by the victim and if such accommodations are reasonably available, regardless of whether victims choose to report the crime to campus police or local law enforcement?

questions.name: q26a
questions.title: Where is information about resources located?

questions.name: q27
questions.title: Does the campus identify faculty members who can provide ongoing support to the following student parties during the institutional disciplinary or criminal process:

questions.name: q27a
questions.title: Where is information about resources located?
